intro: Donax viridiflavescens, commonly known as the green-yellow donax, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, often forming dense mats. It is adapted to saline environments and can tolerate periods of drought. Its botanical features make it an important component of coastal vegetation in its native habitat.
